A

accuracy(List<Example>) - Method in class learn.lc.core.LinearClassifier
Return the proportion of the given Examples that are classified correctly by this LinearClassifier.
activation(double) - Method in class learn.nn.core.LogisticUnit
The activation function for a LogisticUnit is a 0-1 sigmoid centered at z=0: 1/(1+e^(-z)).
activation(double) - Method in class learn.nn.core.NeuronUnit
The activation (threshold) function used by this NeuronUnit.
activation(double) - Method in class learn.nn.core.PerceptronUnit
The activation function for a Perceptron is a hard 0/1 threshold at z=0.
activationPrime(double) - Method in class learn.nn.core.LogisticUnit
Derivative of the activation function for a LogisticUnit.

alpha(int) - Method in class learn.lc.core.DecayingLearningRateSchedule

alpha(int) - Method in interface learn.lc.core.LearningRateSchedule
Return the learning rate alpha for the given iteration t.

B

backprop(Example, double) - Method in class learn.nn.core.MultiLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork
AIMA Fig 18.14 body of loop after propagating inputs forward: (2) Computing the error vector delta (3) ``Propagating deltas backward from output layer to input layer'' (4) ``Update every weight in network using deltas''

initializeWeights() - Method in class learn.nn.core.MultiLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork
AIMA Fig 18.24 says weights should each be initialized to ``a small random number.'' WTF? It also has that step inside the learning loop, which strikes me as very wrong.

M

MultiLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork - Class in learn.nn.core
A MultiLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork is a FeedForwardNeuralNetwork with at least one ``hidden'' layer of units between the inputs and the outputs (AIMA Section 18.7.3).
MultiLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork(int, int[], int) - Constructor for class learn.nn.core.MultiLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork
Construct and return a new MultiLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork with the given number of input units, hidden units (array of lengths, one for each layer), and the given number of output units, where each layer is fully connected to the next.
MultiLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork(int, int, int) - Constructor for class learn.nn.core.MultiLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork
Construct and return a new MultiLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork with the given number of input units, a single hidden layer of the given length, and the given number of output units, where each layer is fully connected to the next.
MultiLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork(Unit[][]) - Constructor for class learn.nn.core.MultiLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork
Construct and return a new MultiLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork with the given layers of Units (InputUnits in the first layer, LogisticUnits in other layers).

AIMA BACK-PROP-LEARNING algorithm (Fig 18.24).
train(Example, double) - Method in class learn.nn.core.MultiLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork
AIMA Fig 18.14 body of loop looks like three steps, but it's really four: (1) ``Propagate the inputs forward to compute the outputs'' (2) Computing the error vector delta (3) ``Propagating deltas backward from output layer to input layer'' (4) ``Update every weight in network using deltas''
train(Example, double) - Method in class learn.nn.core.SingleLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork
Train this SingleLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork on the given Example, using given learning rate alpha.

Train the given NeuralNetwork on the given List of Examples.
